title: China’s first stackable satellite reaches orbit on solid rocket launch
summary: A light-lift solid rocket sent an experimental “plate-like” stackable satellite into orbit late Thursday as the country looks to build its answer to Starlink.

title: New spending caps to create challenges for NASA
summary: NASA and congressional officials are still grappling with the implications of a debt-ceiling agreement that enacts spending caps, but acknowledged it likely means the agency will get less money than it requested for 2024.

title: Video shows Astroscale’s plan to deorbit multiple satellites
summary: In 2025, Astroscale plans to send ELSA-M into very low Earth orbit for commissioning.

title: China outlines ambitious plans for Moon landing; ZhuQue-2 prepares to launch again
summary: Over the last few weeks, China has remained busy with both launching rockets and announcing news, as the country outlined its ambitious plans for its upcoming Lunar program, in which they hope to land a taikonaut on the surface of the Moon by 2030.

title: GAO flags concerns about Space Force satellite procurements
summary: The Government Accountability Office in its annual assessment of Pentagon procurements provided an update on the Space Force’s satellite programs and found a few red flags.

title: Nelco invests in router maker to improve Indian satcoms network
summary: Indian satellite communications provider Nelco has invested around $122 million in a network equipment startup based in Mumbai, India, to bolster its services amid a growing competitive threat from international players.

title: Planet stock drops 25% after satellite data venture lowers annual revenue guidance
summary: Shares of Planet fell after the satellite-imagery and data-analysis company cut its annual revenue guidance following when it reported first-quarter results Thursday.

title: Space Force assigns 12 national security missions to SpaceX and ULA
summary: The U.S. Space Force launch procurement office on June 8 announced an additional 12 missions assigned to SpaceX and United Launch Alliance under the National Security Space Launch Phase 2 contract.

title: SpaceX Dragon capsule breaks U.S. spaceflight records
summary: SpaceX has now launched a flight-proven Dragon capsule to the International Space Station (ISS) 20 times. Following the successful launch and docking...

title: Why – and How – NASA Gives a Name to Every Spot It Studies on Mars
summary: Martian maps are full of monikers recognizing places on Earth, explorers, and even cartoon characters.
